reviewText:
Product received for free

I bought the monthly donor perk or whatever it was and I bought the other 3.99$ thing I believe that was the price. And I never recieved the meteors it promised when buying the monthly donor perk. Anyway it's fun for the first 5 minutes because they give you 500 or 1k meteors. (Basically gems from CoC) Anyway once you run out of those you come to realize how poorly and stupidly this game was put together. Now I know im going to have someone be like wait but you made in game purchaes! Yes... I did. I already have every game I want for the most part and my steam wallet is quite deep" right now. So I thought hey! what can it hurt! So I bought it and only recieved half of what I paid for. The only thing I got was that golden frame on my profile picture. So overall no I don't recomend this game unless you want to waste 5 minutes.

EDIT: (5/27/16) I spent 8.98 In total on this game not to mention a part of my life i'll never get back. And well I went to try and get a refund on steam. And the devs haven't even set up a refund option yet. So I'm left with a feeling of regret every time I scroll thought my library. Oh wait! They have an option to remove it from your library! Well atleast one thing works right on this game..."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Cons:
Pretty much an exact copy of clash of clans  (not really a bad thing)
Clearly meant to be a mobile game due to long waiting times
Long waiting times im talking up to hours maybe weeks i dident get that far
Pay to win  (fair enough its free they have to make money but why do you have to make it pay to win)
If you have a full storage and you battle after the battle the game will crash.
Pros:
Kind of cool concept  (even though its copied from clash of clans)
Nice Gameplay if it wasent such a long wait to get to the battle

Overall the game would be fun as a mobile game because all you do is click a few buttons and put the game down for a few hours while it builds your units or constructs a new part of your base. So i give this game a 4/10 mainly because it is on the wrong platform.

reviewText:
Product received for free

This game seems well made here are some pros and cons

Pros
-Well done translations.
-Is not easy to hack (Dont ask how I found out).
-Enough buildings for a start.
-The buildings menu is a must have but no game has. Good job!
-Easy to get gems.
-Enemy finding is easy and fast.


Cons
-Its not hard to hack, just not easy.
-Graphics could be much better.
-The translations are well but some are mispelled.
-The first thing you see when you start the game is a buying screen! DONT DO THAT.
-Random restarts?
-Damage is low on troops so you should have more time to attack maybe 4min

Notes:
-It is different to put a mobile game on steam.
-I think It would be better If the remaining guys stay with you rather than vanish. Cavemen tend to come back home.

Conclusion:
First of all the pros are for the ones that want to play the same game over and over again!  THIS GAME IS NOT ORIGINAL AT ALL. THIS IS PAY TO WIN, NEVER GET THE GAME. THEY ARE ALL THE SAME!

I wont say positive because this games devs could have thought something different.It cant be that f****** hard to produce something different and usefull. Why Is this game on steam?

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nI downloaded this game with the intention of enjoying it with my mom, and I have to say that I was unimpressed within 20 minutes... We were repeatedly kicked from gameplay, if you move your buildings too much in the tutorial it locks up so you miss half of what you need to know, one of my protective walls disappeared under the map, and overall it was very glitchy. As much as I would like to play this game due to the particularly mobile-like graphics, I have to say no due to all of the bugs. Until this game's errors are fixed, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

reviewerDisplayName: ALT+F4 to see my real name
reviewText: We all know that the gaming industry is filled with unoriginal games. There are more games on the market that simply copy another successful game's style in order to sell well. But never have I ever seen a game that so shamelessly imitates another game, and that game in this case being Clash of Clans. Everything right down to the art style of this game is derived from Clash of Clans. On top of that, Age of Cavemen suffers from some several design flaws. Every time you launch the game, it gives you your daily login reward"
date: even if you have launched the game 40 times in one day. It's also extremely ugly and poorly optimized for modern PCs (I was running the game at 700 frames per second) and 50% of the gameplay is spent closing pop-ups advertising their Facebook and other such annoyances. When you attempt to exit the game
recommended: it even brings up a pop-up in hopes that you'll accidentally click on it! Also
hoursPlayed: the game can barely even be played without buying something with real currency
voteText: making me question if the free2play model can even work. Don't play this game. Do not support this developer by even downloading this game. It's not even one of those games where it is so bad that you get a little gag out of it; it's just purely lazy

reviewText:
What's with all these low energy reviews. Bunch of Liars, Lying Clash I call them. They're angry they're not winning anymore.  Clash has been bleeding gamers everywhere; through their eyes, bleeding through their whatever.  Cavemen makes pay to win great again.

In Clash you make these clans, they're not the best clans. They have lots of problems and they're bringing those problems with you. They don't donate and hop clans. They don't donate then hop into your clan. They're dhoppists....And some, I assume are good clans.

Don't get wrong I love Clash. Clash loves me. I do not repeat myself.  I do not repeat myself.  But I have a great relationship with Clash.  If these two companies weren't like family in gaming, perhaps they'd be man clashing in their caves.  Cavemen makes beautiful games. Big games. Huge games. Cavemen doesn't do small. There's no smallness here. Some people say the game is small and so something else must be small. I can guarantee you there is not a problem. I guarantee.

And I build the best defence towers. Very tall towers. Like 100 a feet .  And I will make the cavemen build them. The beauty of pay to win is that I'm very rich.  I'm really rich.  I have like 10 billion meteorites. When I feel good it's 100 billion. But between 10 to 100 billion.  I'm really rich.  Private caves costs a lot of meteorites. You have to be wealthy in order to win at games, I'm sorry to say it.

If you play cavemen, you'll pay to win so much you'll be tired of winning by paying.
Make pay to win great again.
Thanks Sweetie.

Product received for free

Age of Cavemen is really good game. Give her chance ;)
If you like Clash of Clans this game was for you! AoC hasn't many players and it's easy to get to top 100!

Pros:
- F2P for someone P2W, but it isn't. :)
- Buildings List, where you can upgrade every structure with 2 clicks!
- Towers which attacks enemies has a visible radius, when you click on them.
- You had at start 24 hours of Shield, when nobody CAN'T attack you.
- Many languages (English, Russia,etc..)


Cons:
- In game you can't adjust volume :/
- There isn't toggle button of fullscreen/window

By me 8/10.

reviewText:
Supposedly quite similar to Clash Of Clans, which I've never played. On the other hand it's also similar to Battle Islands, which is one of my favorites.

I like this one too. As with Battle Islands, there's a bit of a wait time when you upgrade your buildings... but you can offset that by using meteorites to speed things up. Meteorites can be earned in-game (at a glacial pace) or purchased with real money.  Your choice, of course.

I think it's fun and I'm going to keep playing. If you don't like games with microtransactions you should probably avoid, but they're okay with me.

And now I'm off to attack some more enemy bases.
